utterances.sentences: He's been too timid. He has been too timid protecting the bureaucracy. This is the premier law enforcement agency in the world. He needs to clean out the .1 percent bad actors and do it vigorously.

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.sentences: Well, he used the term today "by the book", which is the exact same words that then --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Comey.

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.sentences: Well, actually, no. The chairman -- Chairman Grassley and Chairman Graham, they sent a letter asking Susan Rice, who again my -- the lawyer that I'm up against was -- had the words "by the book, Susan Rice." And, you know, it's, again -- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb14', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb14', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: We're going to get to the bottom of it.

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Thank you for being with us.

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.sentences: Thank you so much, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: It shouldn't have happened to any American. Can't happen again. It shouldn't happen to any presidential candidate.

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb15', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb15', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Thank you. Let's not forget the first FISA request in the Carter Page, James Comey signed that. He had mountains of evidence the dossier was biased, unverifiable, piece of garbage, paid for by Hillary -- never verified. And he says on the top of that, verified. Even told President-elect Trump the dossier, this is months later. He signed it on October 2016, January 2017, he said, oh, it's salacious, but unverified. Well, he lied then or lied in October or he lied both times. Now, remember, as Deputy A.G. Rod Rosenstein said, an official who signs off on a FISA request, must swear the information used in that is true and correct or there are severe consequences. And Kevin Brock, the former assistant director of intelligence at the FBI, put it this way: James Comey is in trouble, he knows it. The 25-year FBI vet believes that Comey's flurry of public activity shows that he is desperately trying to shake the narrative. But at the end of the day, truth is more important than any spin of Jim Comey. Comey did not want Trump to become president, hated him. As a self- aggrandized super patriot that knows better than we smelly Walmart people, irredeemable deplorables, he was clearly willing to do anything to stop Trump, spying, leaking and worse, and signing off on the biggest Russian lies ever put together by the opposition party, using the tools of intelligence, weaponizing them against the American people. And an opposition party campaign. It can't happen again. It is this program's mission to hold all of these people accountable. James Comey, tick-tock. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } Here now, Fox News contributor, Sara Carter. Former Clinton pollster Mark Penn is with us. You know, you're one of the few Democrats that have been out there saying something to your party that this is not going to end well for you. That this is really bad, what you've engaged in here. But they keep doubling down. Why?

utterances.speaker: MARK PENN, FORMER CLINTON POLLSTER
utterances.sentences: Well, I've been trying to say, hey, talk about health care. The Mueller report's out. There was no Trump- Russia collusion. If you went back and read the dossier, you would laugh. If you knew that it was paid for by the DNC, you would laugh. If you read --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: It is funny when you read it.

utterances.speaker: PENN
utterances.sentences: It is. It's absolutely incredible. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } You read the Page-Strzok texts, one, two, three, you knew that this was never going anywhere --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: How did 99 percent of America's media -- the mob, I call them -- and Democrats, they put all their faith and hope -- they didn't think Trump would win and they didn't think Mueller report would come back this way.

utterances.speaker: PENN
utterances.sentences: Yes, they never thought Mueller would come back this way, and it's unbelievable. How did we spend two years, two years? And you were right - - once you uncovered the information that said, you know what, these folks were biased, this thing was paid for by a political campaign, they created a massive echo chamber inside our government with false information. This should never happen.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And also, they rigged the investigation into Hillary. The attorney general stated it very clearly, Sara Carter, this is now all - - we're going back to square one. This is where we'll get the FISA applications, Gang of Eight, 302s, we'll examine how they rigged -- even Page and Strzok were laughing and making fun of the fact that it was a rigged investigation.

utterances.speaker: SARA CARTER, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: They pointed it right in -- put it right in the attorney general's office at the time, Loretta Lynch. She's got problems. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: That's right, Sean. And now, they need to get all of the documents -- look, John's recent story actually revealed is that they knew prior to getting the FISA, right, that they were -- that they were -- that they were going after -- this was a political opportunity for Christopher Steele. Those in the DNC and the Hillary Clinton campaign. So, what it's actually saying is that the FBI was utilizing disinformation from the Russians, lying to the FISA courts so that they could spy on Carter Page. And now we have to ask ourselves this: how many more people within the Trump sphere were also -- were also spied on or also utilized to spy on members of the Trump campaign. I think this is what Devin Nunes wants to find out. This is what Senator Grassley as well as Senator Graham are looking into. How many people within that sphere were actually utilized, because every day we find more and more information that points in that direction? That our intelligence community, the law enforcement was weaponized?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Knowing just what we know -- knowing just what we know does exist, and that is coming out, to what extent will the conscience of the American people in your view be shocked?

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: They will be extraordinarily shocked. This is going to be an avalanche of information. People will be indicted because of this. I think that, you know, we could see the intensity with Attorney General William Barr during his testimony. And he would not be that intense, he would not be that adamant if he didn't know something more.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Agreed.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: I believe there are ongoing investigations now and the first one we've got to see is Michael Horowitz. We've got -- once that comes out, everything else follows. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: That's coming. Tick-tock. Last question for you, Mark Penn. So every day between now and election day 2020, your party -- I say that respectfully -- you're not your party, they focus on this, they stay on this, they obsess on impeachment. Let's get those tax returns. OK, we all knew Atlantic City was a dump, and everybody lost money, Trump's still a billionaire. How bad does it hurt them?

utterances.speaker: PENN
utterances.sentences: Well, look, if they focus on this, it's not a winning issue. Then Trump will win on the economy. They have to focus on health care, education --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Is it the economy, stupid?

utterances.speaker: PENN
utterances.sentences: Hey, it's the economy if he can make it the economy and keep it going. We'll see if he gets through this China tariff thing. But I say to Democrats, get off impeachment, get on the issues.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Good luck with that. I don't think they're listening. Good to see you. Thanks. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: PENN
utterances.sentences: Not so far.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. A busy news night. Lindsey Graham is here next. What will he and his committee be up to? And breaking news on the abuses in the Russia investigation, we will chronicle that new news straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. It's already been a really bad week for the deep state. Here to talk about the very latest developments and help break it all down, Senate Judiciary Committee Chairman Lindsey Graham. You know, I had you on -- although when you don't avoid the show by traveling all over the world and you make yourself available. This is your first job, I don't understand why you say no.

utterances.speaker: SEN. LINDSEY GRAHAM, R-S.C.
utterances.sentences: My bad. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Very bad, exactly, I agree. Steele's stunning pre-FISA confessions, this new report, and the closed door testimony where we know Bruce Ohr under oath said, well, I told everybody in August of 2016, it's an unverified document -- the dossier -- and Steele hates Trump and Hillary paid for it. You know, as I do, that it's unverified, but does it not say at the top of a FISA warrant, I just learned this today, verified?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, it's supposed to be. You're supposed to say under oath to the court that the document I'm presenting to you is accurate. That's the whole point of getting a warrant. You got to have reliable information. But why is this so important? We know in August of 2016, Ohr tells the FBI senior leadership, you got to watch this Steele guy, he's out to get Trump. Now, what do we know? That Christopher Steele went to the Department of State on October the 11th to try to get the Department of State to release the dossier to the public for political reasons. They tell the FBI, this is ten days before they get the first warrant application verified. So, ten days before they applied for the FISA warrant, they were told in August that Steele's out to get Trump. In October, Steele goes to the State Department trying to get them to release it to the public for a political reason.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You know, you can't even make this up.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I understand there is a Florida case and we might get information from Steele, but we do know in the interrogatory where he was under the threat of perjury, he actually said, I have no idea if any of this is true, 50/50 at best. So, doesn't that then render the dossier, the dirty Russian dossier unverifiable?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, why is this important? We should all be concerned if our government is getting a warrant against an American citizen under FISA Surveillance Act without accurate information. What do we know? We know that without the dossier, the warrant would not have been issued. People in charge tell us that. We now know that the author of the dossier, Christopher Steele, was on the payroll of the Democratic Party. He was not a reliable informant for the FBI. He was trying to destroy Trump because he was paid by the Democrats to take Trump down. They knew all of this. They should have known all of this before they applied for the warrant. So, here's what needs to happen. Somebody needs to go to the FISA court and tell them that the FBI had plenty of notice that this guy was on the payroll of the Democratic Party and he was out to get Trump and the dossier was not verified the day they signed it (ph).

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Senator, I'm not that smart. Would that be a conspiracy to commit fraud on a FISA court? And where I grew up in New York--

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: --And I know of down in South Carolina where you grew up--

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes. You were--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: --You were living in a bar, I was working in a bar until 4:30. We have similar backgrounds. Where I grew up, you say, "yes ma'am, no ma'am, yes sir, no sir, yes your honor, no your honor," and if you lie to the judge, it's not going to work out really well in the end.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, here is the question, how could you not know that Steele should be looked at really hard given what Ohr said and given his actions on October 11th? You got to remember, the guy who started this, Steele, went to the State Department and I don't know why he went to the State Department, for the express purpose of having the State Department release the dossier before the election.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And that was memorialized we now know. That's the interesting part and we have more e-mails coming.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: 10 days before the warrant.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Let me ask you -- before the warrant. Just like Ohr said. He told everything.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Let me go to Robert Mueller for a second. You said you don't care whether or not he testifies, that's up to him.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Trump may stop it. But I don't know if I want that. Because Mueller, I want to know when did he know there was no conspiracy with the Trump Campaign and Russia as it relates to collusion of any kind. When did he know that or why did he hire only Democrats and even Hillary's attorney and one attorney known for withholding exculpatory evidence and having a really bad track record and failing? And why was he not concerned about Hillary's dirty Russian dossier when he had plenty of time to look into the medallions and pharaoh laws and loan applications and taxes? I would think the Russian dossier would have been important to Robert Mueller, but what do I know?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, I need - somebody needs to look at this like Mueller looked at Trump. And here's the question. Why would the FBI classify this exchange between Steele and the State Department and the FBI April of this year?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Wow. Now, this is pretty interesting.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: They classified--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Will you pledge to the American people tonight, Senator? As the Attorney General told you, I thought you had the best line of questioning last week. That it's important if Hillary's investigation into criminal activity was rigged, whether or not they tried to rig a presidential election--

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes, right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: --whether a fraud was committed against the FISA court.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: --whether there was leaking of intel, whether the intel community was weaponized against the American people, and whether or not they tried to bludgeon the President of the United States, whether the opposition party candidate lies to unseat a duly elected president, are all those issues on the table?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: You better believe it for Attorney General Barr and myself. We got to get to the bottom of it and make sure it never happens again.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Is the Mueller issue dead now?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Case closed.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Senator. You're dismissed.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Thank you for being with us. All right. Coming up, 2020 candidate, yes, Uncle Pete, Mayor Pete, he says he doesn't think God is a Republican. Wow, how insightful. Dan Bongino, Geraldo are next, and you are going to meet the American serviceman that was pardoned by the President yesterday in an exclusive interview.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And so, now with the collusion narrative dead, buried, and no vision for America's future at all. Yes, the 2020 extreme radical socialist Democrats are already resorting to baseless predictable smears of President Trump and the GOP. He had it every two and four years, racist, sexist, homophobic, xenophobic, islamophobic, all they want, dirty air, water, kill children and throw granny over the cliff. Get used to that. Just yesterday, we showed you crazy Uncle Joe claiming conservatives want to bring back Jim Crow laws using some of the same lines from the old Clinton playbook. Even The New York Times, they're taking notice, writing a new piece. So, 2020 Biden has given Democrats a little 2016 Clinton flashbacks, especially as Biden is already running scared like having to walk back his comments on China, among a host of other issues, including his treatment of Anita Hill. And now, all of this could create a huge pathway for new crop of even more radical Democrats like media darling Mayor Pete who is ramping up his attacks on Christian values and conservatives. Sounds a little bit like irredeemable, deplorable, smelly Walmart people clinging to their God, guns, bibles and religion. I think I've heard this, seen this movie and I've heard this movie before.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You've also spent a fair amount of time talking about your faith.

utterances.speaker: MAYOR PETE BUTTIGIEG, SOUTH BEND, IND., D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: MAYOR PETE
utterances.sentences: It's important to me. And I think it's also important that we stop seeing religion used as kind of cajole, as if God belonged to a political party. And if He did, I can't imagine He would be the one that sent the current President to the White House.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Now Mayor Pete Buttigieg, oh, he's not stopping there. Yesterday, telling supporters that America was never all that great to begin with. Let's see, my father who fought four years in the pacific in World War II, the America that beat back fascism and communism, Nazism, and imperial Japan and has taken the brunt on the fight, radical Islamists that wanted to destroy us on 9/11/2001 -- nah, nothing great about any of that? Really? Take a look.

utterances.speaker: BUTTIGIEG
utterances.sentences: The solutions I believe are going to come from our communities. Communities like the one where I grew up, which is an industrial mid- western city. That is exactly the kind of place that our current President targeted with a message saying that we could find greatness by just stopping the clock and turning it back, and making America great again. When that past that he is promising to return us to was never as great as advertised, especially for marginalized Americans, and there's no going back anyway.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Here with reaction, Fox News Contributor Dan Bongino, Fox News Correspondent-at-large Geraldo Rivera. Geraldo, I'll take that guy (ph), I'll take the bait. Biden-Obama, 13 million more Americans food stamps, 8 million more on poverty, lowest labor participation rates since the ‘70s, worst recovery since the '40s, lowest home ownership rate in 51 years, and they took on more debt than every president before them combined. Now, we have record-low unemployment for everybody. I think I'll take Trump's record. I'm just betting.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.sentences: First of all, I think Mayor Pete is totally off the mark, Sean. I believe that God is a reflection of each of us, of all of us. So I tend to think of God as a progressive Republican, probably part Jewish, part Puerto Rican catholic, kind of cute, mustache. I think that he is - it was a joke.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Thank you for your belayed laugh. In terms of Make America Great Again, I think Pete is guilty of being very, very gloomy there. To me, Make America Great Again harkens to the time when we were growing up, when we -- America didn't have social media and divisive cable news shows, and everybody was in it together, and we all thought anybody could be anything we wanted. It was a feeling of togetherness, America as a unit, all of us pulling together in the same direction. That I think is what Donald Trump meant when he coined the phrase Make America Great Again. He didn't mean harkening back to slavery or wiping out Native Americans, or Jim Crow. He meant the America where we - the America of great possibilities.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Hey, we have--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The America of inclusion.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Dan, we have record-low unemployment. We've got a booming economy. Europe is 0.3 GDP growth in the last two quarters combined. 0.3 percent. We're 3.2 with a government shutdown. 1.7 million more jobs than we have Americans on right now, unemployment. That's a lot of jobs. They're begging people in prison, when are you getting out, we need you.

utterances.speaker: DAN BONGINO, CONTRIBUTING EDITOR
utterances.sentences: Yes, Sean. And the latest economic numbers show that the poorest Americans, the bottom tenth percentile, their wages grew at double the rate of the richest Americans. So, the Democrats being in it for the little guy is a scam, like it has always been. But, aren't you embarrassed by your party if you're a Democrat right now? No, I mean it. I mean think about, Sean, what we've seen just in the last year from the hapless Democrats decent into ideological madness. We've seen infanticide in some cases, late-term abortion in many cases. We've seen Kamala Harris and Bernie Sanders advocate for a terrorist voting from prison. We've seen Julian Castro support a 90% tax rate. Elizabeth Warren suggesting a takeover of corporate boardrooms and Bernie Sanders suggesting your private insurance plan you get from your employer should be thrown in the garbage can, so people like Bernie can manage your healthcare. Ladies and gentlemen, their words, not mine. That's your party, Democrats. I hope you're proud.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Well, said. Geraldo, look, does this get any traction? New Green Deal, impeachment, impeach Barr, hate Trump, does it get them anywhere?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: First of all, I hope that Mueller testifies because I would love to cross-examine him.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Me too.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: --about when he suspected to the depth of his experience that President Trump did not conspire with the Russians to overthrow the United States--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Oh, John Dowd said a year prior.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I want to know and then why he didn't tell the President of the United States. One more thing about Mayor Pete. There is - he was very attractive, very - he is an articulate guy and he deserves a second look. But he is desperate to get the African-American vote. He has zero African-American support. He knows South Carolina is up after Iowa and New Hampshire. He knows he needs the African-American vote to get the Democratic primary. He's desperate; he is flailing around. He's trying to redefine himself as the guy who didn't fire in 2007 the black Police Chief of South Bend, Indiana, which he did. And that's the deficit he's trying to overcome, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right, thank you both as always. President Trump, he just pardoned an Iraqi veteran convicted of killing a suspected Al-Qaeda terrorist, former army first lieutenant Michael Behenna. He will join us exclusively, share that story. You won't see this anywhere else. You want to see this next.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yesterday, President Trump, he pardoned ex-army first lieutenant Michael Behenna who was convicted in 2009 of killing a suspected Al-Qaeda terrorist in Iraq. Behenna originally received a sentence of 25 years in prison for unpremeditated murder on a combat zone. But they were concerns about how the trial court addressed his self-defense claim and in announcing the pardon, White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders mentioned broad support from Behenna saying, "from the military, Oklahoma elected officials, the public." He is now here to tell his story in his own words and react to today's news along with his parents, Vicki and Scott. Good to see you all. Let me start, if you don't mind, you were - Michael, you wanted to serve your country, correct?

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL BEHENNA, FORMER ARMY FIRST LIEUTENANT
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Okay. And you found yourself in a situation where you were managing a 17-man platoon and an IED went off and killed four people, two of them yours.

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And how many were injured?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.sentences: There was five injured.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Five people injured, two lost their lives -- two others lost their lives. You've read the intelligence, which was your job, and you heard about an Al-Qaeda operative named Ali Mansur, correct?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And you worked for the local sheik and you brought him into custody, correct?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And Mansur was then ordered released by the army. And your commander told you to transport the guy home, right?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And you did a field interrogation of Mr. Mansur, right?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And in the process of that, even with an interpreter with you during the interrogation, Mansur tried to get your weapon.

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And you, fearing for your life, killed him.

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Okay. The odds were pretty high that he was the Al-Qaeda explosive deliverer?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And so now prosecutors, as I understand it during your court martial, they had exculpatory evidence that they built -- they were told your defense lawyers that they hired a forensic expert, and tell us what the forensic expert found and why did he not testify.

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.sentences: That forensic expert was actually sitting in trial during my testimony and he heard -- he heard my side of the story for the first time. After he heard my story, he went back to the prosecutors and did a demonstration to them in the room and told them -- or he -- I'm sorry. Let me back up. Once I told my story, he had -- he had told the prosecutors, that's exactly what I told you yesterday. Because he had did a demonstration for the prosecution team the day before, the day before he heard my testimony.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: So he, the prosecution hires a forensic expert who confirms your story.

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA

utterances.utterance: Senator, I'm not that smart. Would that be a conspiracy to commit fraud on a FISA court? And where I grew up in New York--

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --And I know of down in South Carolina where you grew up--

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes. You were--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --You were living in a bar, I was working in a bar until 4:30. We have similar backgrounds. Where I grew up, you say, "yes ma'am, no ma'am, yes sir, no sir, yes your honor, no your honor," and if you lie to the judge, it's not going to work out really well in the end.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Well, here is the question, how could you not know that Steele should be looked at really hard given what Ohr said and given his actions on October 11th? You got to remember, the guy who started this, Steele, went to the State Department and I don't know why he went to the State Department, for the express purpose of having the State Department release the dossier before the election.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And that was memorialized we now know. That's the interesting part and we have more e-mails coming.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: 10 days before the warrant.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me ask you -- before the warrant. Just like Ohr said. He told everything.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me go to Robert Mueller for a second. You said you don't care whether or not he testifies, that's up to him.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Trump may stop it. But I don't know if I want that. Because Mueller, I want to know when did he know there was no conspiracy with the Trump Campaign and Russia as it relates to collusion of any kind. When did he know that or why did he hire only Democrats and even Hillary's attorney and one attorney known for withholding exculpatory evidence and having a really bad track record and failing? And why was he not concerned about Hillary's dirty Russian dossier when he had plenty of time to look into the medallions and pharaoh laws and loan applications and taxes? I would think the Russian dossier would have been important to Robert Mueller, but what do I know?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Well, I need - somebody needs to look at this like Mueller looked at Trump. And here's the question. Why would the FBI classify this exchange between Steele and the State Department and the FBI April of this year?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Wow. Now, this is pretty interesting.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: They classified--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Will you pledge to the American people tonight, Senator? As the Attorney General told you, I thought you had the best line of questioning last week. That it's important if Hillary's investigation into criminal activity was rigged, whether or not they tried to rig a presidential election--

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes, right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --whether a fraud was committed against the FISA court.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --whether there was leaking of intel, whether the intel community was weaponized against the American people, and whether or not they tried to bludgeon the President of the United States, whether the opposition party candidate lies to unseat a duly elected president, are all those issues on the table?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: You better believe it for Attorney General Barr and myself. We got to get to the bottom of it and make sure it never happens again.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Is the Mueller issue dead now?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Case closed.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Senator. You're dismissed.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Thank you for being with us. All right. Coming up, 2020 candidate, yes, Uncle Pete, Mayor Pete, he says he doesn't think God is a Republican. Wow, how insightful. Dan Bongino, Geraldo are next, and you are going to meet the American serviceman that was pardoned by the President yesterday in an exclusive interview.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And so, now with the collusion narrative dead, buried, and no vision for America's future at all. Yes, the 2020 extreme radical socialist Democrats are already resorting to baseless predictable smears of President Trump and the GOP. He had it every two and four years, racist, sexist, homophobic, xenophobic, islamophobic, all they want, dirty air, water, kill children and throw granny over the cliff. Get used to that. Just yesterday, we showed you crazy Uncle Joe claiming conservatives want to bring back Jim Crow laws using some of the same lines from the old Clinton playbook. Even The New York Times, they're taking notice, writing a new piece. So, 2020 Biden has given Democrats a little 2016 Clinton flashbacks, especially as Biden is already running scared like having to walk back his comments on China, among a host of other issues, including his treatment of Anita Hill. And now, all of this could create a huge pathway for new crop of even more radical Democrats like media darling Mayor Pete who is ramping up his attacks on Christian values and conservatives. Sounds a little bit like irredeemable, deplorable, smelly Walmart people clinging to their God, guns, bibles and religion. I think I've heard this, seen this movie and I've heard this movie before.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You've also spent a fair amount of time talking about your faith.

utterances.speaker: MAYOR PETE BUTTIGIEG, SOUTH BEND, IND., D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: MAYOR PETE
utterances.utterance: It's important to me. And I think it's also important that we stop seeing religion used as kind of cajole, as if God belonged to a political party. And if He did, I can't imagine He would be the one that sent the current President to the White House.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Now Mayor Pete Buttigieg, oh, he's not stopping there. Yesterday, telling supporters that America was never all that great to begin with. Let's see, my father who fought four years in the pacific in World War II, the America that beat back fascism and communism, Nazism, and imperial Japan and has taken the brunt on the fight, radical Islamists that wanted to destroy us on 9/11/2001 -- nah, nothing great about any of that? Really? Take a look.

utterances.speaker: BUTTIGIEG
utterances.utterance: The solutions I believe are going to come from our communities. Communities like the one where I grew up, which is an industrial mid- western city. That is exactly the kind of place that our current President targeted with a message saying that we could find greatness by just stopping the clock and turning it back, and making America great again. When that past that he is promising to return us to was never as great as advertised, especially for marginalized Americans, and there's no going back anyway.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here with reaction, Fox News Contributor Dan Bongino, Fox News Correspondent-at-large Geraldo Rivera. Geraldo, I'll take that guy (ph), I'll take the bait. Biden-Obama, 13 million more Americans food stamps, 8 million more on poverty, lowest labor participation rates since the ‘70s, worst recovery since the '40s, lowest home ownership rate in 51 years, and they took on more debt than every president before them combined. Now, we have record-low unemployment for everybody. I think I'll take Trump's record. I'm just betting.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.utterance: First of all, I think Mayor Pete is totally off the mark, Sean. I believe that God is a reflection of each of us, of all of us. So I tend to think of God as a progressive Republican, probably part Jewish, part Puerto Rican catholic, kind of cute, mustache. I think that he is - it was a joke.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Thank you for your belayed laugh. In terms of Make America Great Again, I think Pete is guilty of being very, very gloomy there. To me, Make America Great Again harkens to the time when we were growing up, when we -- America didn't have social media and divisive cable news shows, and everybody was in it together, and we all thought anybody could be anything we wanted. It was a feeling of togetherness, America as a unit, all of us pulling together in the same direction. That I think is what Donald Trump meant when he coined the phrase Make America Great Again. He didn't mean harkening back to slavery or wiping out Native Americans, or Jim Crow. He meant the America where we - the America of great possibilities.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Hey, we have--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The America of inclusion.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Dan, we have record-low unemployment. We've got a booming economy. Europe is 0.3 GDP growth in the last two quarters combined. 0.3 percent. We're 3.2 with a government shutdown. 1.7 million more jobs than we have Americans on right now, unemployment. That's a lot of jobs. They're begging people in prison, when are you getting out, we need you.

utterances.speaker: DAN BONGINO, CONTRIBUTING EDITOR
utterances.utterance: Yes, Sean. And the latest economic numbers show that the poorest Americans, the bottom tenth percentile, their wages grew at double the rate of the richest Americans. So, the Democrats being in it for the little guy is a scam, like it has always been. But, aren't you embarrassed by your party if you're a Democrat right now? No, I mean it. I mean think about, Sean, what we've seen just in the last year from the hapless Democrats decent into ideological madness. We've seen infanticide in some cases, late-term abortion in many cases. We've seen Kamala Harris and Bernie Sanders advocate for a terrorist voting from prison. We've seen Julian Castro support a 90% tax rate. Elizabeth Warren suggesting a takeover of corporate boardrooms and Bernie Sanders suggesting your private insurance plan you get from your employer should be thrown in the garbage can, so people like Bernie can manage your healthcare. Ladies and gentlemen, their words, not mine. That's your party, Democrats. I hope you're proud.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Well, said. Geraldo, look, does this get any traction? New Green Deal, impeachment, impeach Barr, hate Trump, does it get them anywhere?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: First of all, I hope that Mueller testifies because I would love to cross-examine him.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Me too.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: --about when he suspected to the depth of his experience that President Trump did not conspire with the Russians to overthrow the United States--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Oh, John Dowd said a year prior.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I want to know and then why he didn't tell the President of the United States. One more thing about Mayor Pete. There is - he was very attractive, very - he is an articulate guy and he deserves a second look. But he is desperate to get the African-American vote. He has zero African-American support. He knows South Carolina is up after Iowa and New Hampshire. He knows he needs the African-American vote to get the Democratic primary. He's desperate; he is flailing around. He's trying to redefine himself as the guy who didn't fire in 2007 the black Police Chief of South Bend, Indiana, which he did. And that's the deficit he's trying to overcome, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right, thank you both as always. President Trump, he just pardoned an Iraqi veteran convicted of killing a suspected Al-Qaeda terrorist, former army first lieutenant Michael Behenna. He will join us exclusively, share that story. You won't see this anywhere else. You want to see this next.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yesterday, President Trump, he pardoned ex-army first lieutenant Michael Behenna who was convicted in 2009 of killing a suspected Al-Qaeda terrorist in Iraq. Behenna originally received a sentence of 25 years in prison for unpremeditated murder on a combat zone. But they were concerns about how the trial court addressed his self-defense claim and in announcing the pardon, White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders mentioned broad support from Behenna saying, "from the military, Oklahoma elected officials, the public." He is now here to tell his story in his own words and react to today's news along with his parents, Vicki and Scott. Good to see you all. Let me start, if you don't mind, you were - Michael, you wanted to serve your country, correct?

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL BEHENNA, FORMER ARMY FIRST LIEUTENANT
utterances.utterance: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Okay. And you found yourself in a situation where you were managing a 17-man platoon and an IED went off and killed four people, two of them yours.

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And how many were injured?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: There was five injured.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Five people injured, two lost their lives -- two others lost their lives. You've read the intelligence, which was your job, and you heard about an Al-Qaeda operative named Ali Mansur, correct?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And you worked for the local sheik and you brought him into custody, correct?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And Mansur was then ordered released by the army. And your commander told you to transport the guy home, right?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And you did a field interrogation of Mr. Mansur, right?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: I did.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And in the process of that, even with an interpreter with you during the interrogation, Mansur tried to get your weapon.

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And you, fearing for your life, killed him.

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Okay. The odds were pretty high that he was the Al-Qaeda explosive deliverer?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And so now prosecutors, as I understand it during your court martial, they had exculpatory evidence that they built -- they were told your defense lawyers that they hired a forensic expert, and tell us what the forensic expert found and why did he not testify.

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: That forensic expert was actually sitting in trial during my testimony and he heard -- he heard my side of the story for the first time. After he heard my story, he went back to the prosecutors and did a demonstration to them in the room and told them -- or he -- I'm sorry. Let me back up. Once I told my story, he had -- he had told the prosecutors, that's exactly what I told you yesterday. Because he had did a demonstration for the prosecution team the day before, the day before he heard my testimony.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So he, the prosecution hires a forensic expert who confirms your story.

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And then they don't tell your defense attorney. And this is how we treat American heroes? And then they send him home and he doesn't testify. Why would -- why would we send brave men and women - and I got to believe, Vicki and Scott, you sent your son and he's willing to risk his life for his country, and he has to defend himself. Now, we're going to second guess his decision. We have exculpatory evidence and they withheld it? How does that make a mother and father feel?

utterances.speaker: VICKI BEHENNA, MOTHER OF MICHAEL BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: Well, I can just tell you from my perspective, being a federal prosecutor for over 25 years, it was something I'd never witnessed before. It was a trial where the forensic evidence was not introduced by the prosecution, but by the defense.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: It was withheld on purpose, ma'am. With all due respect, I'm going to be a little more blunt. They knew it. They didn't bring it up.

utterances.speaker: VICKI BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: Well, they definitely should have told, they have an ethical and constitutional responsibility to turn that evidence over once a forensic expert says that he doesn't believe their theory of an execution is accurate.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And Scott, as the father of Michael, an American hero, I got to imagine your son in eleven or (ph) for five years for something he was unjustly convicted of, I bet you have real anger issues with the people that did that because I know as a father, I would.

utterances.speaker: SCOTT BEHENNA, FATHER OF MICHAEL BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: It's hard, Sean. You know, five years passes very slowly in a prison. And we were fortunate to visit him very often which helped quite extensively, but you're right. I mean we were initially very angry. But you focus your attention on helping him and that's what we've tried to do for all these years, with all the support. You mentioned AG Hunter and President Trump, finally coming through. This is amazing day, exciting day.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Michael, you lost five years of your life. You defended your country honorably. President did this at the request of 37 generals, admirals, and politicians in Oklahoma where you're from. President called you yesterday. How did this all feel?

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: It was -- it was totally unexpected. And I want to -- I want to personally thank President Trump and this is something he didn't have to do. I'm just grateful that he even considered my pardon petition. And it was one of the happiest moments of my life.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I agree. And I hope that every single case that we had, these rules of engagement, these guys -- I want every case reviewed, every single case. Welcome home, soldier. Thank you for serving your country.

utterances.speaker: BEHENNA
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And to mom and dad, you guys have an unbelievable son and what loving parents you are. I'm glad it worked out right. Sorry you went through all that. We owe you better as a country, straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We can ever do that to American soldiers ever again. We need a top to bottom review. All of these guys that served this country, rules of engagement and we second-guess them from the comforts of our living room or some office in DC? That has got to stop. Anyway, we will never be the destroy-Trump media mob. Always fair and balanced. Let not your heart be troubled. Laura Ingraham is in Houston tonight. Laura?
